case_vignette:
A 51-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of diffuse perineal and scrotal pain. On a 10-point scale, he rates the pain as a 5 to 6. He reports that during this time he also has pain during ejaculation and dysuria. He did not have fever. The pain is persistent despite taking over-the-counter analgesics. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 20 years. He appears healthy and well nourished. Vital signs are within normal limits. Abdominal and scrotal examination shows no abnormalities. Rectal examination shows a mildly tender prostate without asymmetry or induration. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 13.2 g/dL
Leukocyte count 5000/mm3
Platelet count 320,000/mm3
Urine
RBC none
WBC 4-5/hpf
A urine culture is negative. Analysis of expressed prostatic secretions shows 6 WBCs/hpf (N <10). Scrotal ultrasonography shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Renal and Genitourinary System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having pain around my lower pelvic area and my scrotal area for the past three months, and it hurts when I ejaculate and when I pee.
How old are you?
I am 51 years old.
Do you have any history of urinary tract infections or sexually transmitted infections? If so, when was the last time you were treated for one?
No, I haven't had any urinary tract or sexually transmitted infections.
Do you have a history of any medical conditions such as diabetes, hypertension, or kidney disease?
No, I do not have a history of those medical conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
I've been taking over-the-counter painkillers for the pain, but they haven't helped.
Do you have a family history of prostate problems or testicular cancer?
I don't know about any family history of prostate problems or testicular cancer.
**Final Diagnosis:** Chronic Prostatitis/Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome

The pain occurs during ejaculation and urination. The patient has been taking over-the-counter painkillers but has not found relief. The patient denies any history of urinary tract or sexually transmitted infections and has no family history of prostate problems or testicular cancer.
